google_play_reviews.content: Negativity will cook your goose. Word of advice , NEVER, respond to a user with a negative response. You're likely to get more negative or lose the user entirely. Be apologetic and kindly explain the technical issue and work to correct the situation. Ultimately play store will review it. Sometimes the user doesn't get the issue . That's OK, you'll help them to understand ,you'll be happy ,they'll be happy and other users won't see that negativity. - Professional Developer MPC
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks! Because these apps are a result of free-time, I think it's appropriate to make clear to a user who writes a bad review without trying to help fixing the issue that we are not a company like Google and that this project only exists because of our motivation. I think I never was that negative, but I appreciate your advice!

google_play_reviews.content: Great job on this app! Very useful with the web app!
Thank you for your app. As a professional developer, I appreciate the free time you guys gave and continue to give to this app.
Chores notification when??
google_play_reviews.replyContent: You can follow the project and its progress on GitHub, there you would see that we are currently working on a big redesign and on the Meal Plan feature. We don't have that much time, we are both studying.

google_play_reviews.content: Useful but missing a few key features in the chore department: * Needs to allow changing who completed a chore when completing it to avoid everything being "done" by the service account that the communal tablet is logged into (The Chore Tracking web UI contains a "done by" drop-down that this app lacks.) * Also missing is chore notifications - even when housemates are on board with grocy, nobody realizes they have assigned chores without notifications

Normally don't write reviews but I love the app but wished the shopping list would show columns like the server does. More over, when I add a custom field, it to would carry over. On the server I added an Isle column so I would know which Isle an item is in instead of searching for it each time I go.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Please use issues on GitHub for feature requests instead of writing them in a review as we cannot track anything here. I would say that the server (on phone screens) also only uses rows instead of columns and we think a table layout is not really useful on phone screens, so we decided to make a simple list. Custom fields can be implemented I think.

google_play_reviews.content: I usually don't write reviews much but after seeing two bad reviews for this excellent (and mind you FREE) app for an excellent (and also FREE), I couldn't help it. Thanks so much for giving me the perfect solution to multiple problems I had in my household! Keep up the great work and please don't be discouraged by bad reviews. As a developer myself, I know how frustrating it can be. So again, thank you!

Impressed how far along the app is at this point. Love the recipes addition! (Maybe for recipes, but more so to be able to do quick consume of all ingredients for a recipe vs entering each individually PLUS to have item lists for recipes when shopping and impromptu decide want to get needed items for a saved recipe.) Viewing stock entries is here! Stock journal next? But FIRST would love to be able to easily switch between multiple Grocy instances. Can't wait to see future progress! Bravo!!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks a lot! Recipes are in progress and stock entries came with the latest version, released yesterday. Happy Easter!

google_play_reviews.content: This connects to my locally-hosted Grocy instance in Docker. It has most of the functionality of the website, and seems to be more responsive as well! Thank you for making this free app; looking forward to updates! You both are excellent coders and I would like to donate (PayPal, GitHub Sponsor?)
Beautiful and functional interface
Well designed and easy to use
A big thanks...it's free guys, we should say thanks

Latest version of this app is v2.2.1, and it does not work with demo server v3.3.1, nor with HA add-on which I find tragi-comic. The app informs you that the versions needs to match, which is not possible as it seams the dwvelopement of the server and client app are not synchronized. As I have said I have tried and failed to connect to my Homeassistant Grocy add-on with valid API key. Btw. my HA add-on IS latest v3.3.1.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi, first: we are two brothers who develop this app completely independent from the main project by Bernd Bestel in our freetime and we are both studying right know. 2.: One-star reviews are just demotivating. 3.: Simply read the pop-up message in the app, it says you can ignore it. 4.: https://github.com/patzly/grocy-android/issues/558

google_play_reviews.content: Please support grocy ver. 3.2
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks! With the latest update everything should be fine.

google_play_reviews.content: Awesome app! Very streamlined. Good job. Please add chores functionality and I will surely buy the full version :)
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thank you very much! The latest version implements chores ;)

google_play_reviews.content: This is awesome! Exactly what my wife and i were looking for! This app and also the WebUI, basically everything is so well thought through and easy to use. Thank you very much to the creators!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thank you too! Especially for the big compliments and the five stars :)

google_play_reviews.content: it works. kind of. i get "an error occurred" every time i commit a product in inventory mode.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Please check the permissions for your user and if it still doesn't work please open an issue on GitHub.

google_play_reviews.content: Cant connect to own server. Even with QR code you cant connect to your own server. I expected the server know its own address. Also what is "Long-lived access token" at least give the user the ootion to use username/password. Or give the user help to create/find the required information. NOT user friendly setup experience. **edit** Google search should not be required. And i have server knowledge. it is the userfriendlyness the app lacks. And no link to faq for the token lokation.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks, if you would ask for help more friendly instead of leaving a negative review we would be happy to spend our free-time to help you. Is a detailed FAQ a not-userfriendly experience? Edit: Google should be your best friend regarding technical questions, otherwise this app would not even existüí™üèº Tap the questionmark button for a FAQ.

google_play_reviews.content: Works great with the home assistant add-on of grocy. I like the shopping mode, the items are easy to cross of and sync fast when shopping together. I would love to see some features added: - recipes - automatically add items from the shopping mode as purchased items - fast scan mode for purchasing (like for consuming) Thanks for developing a good grocy app.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your review! We will work on the recipes feature soon. The option to purchase all done items in a shopping list is already available in the bottom menu! Quick mode is also available on purchase page, all fields will be automatically filled and the purchase executed if all necessary data is available. Best regards, Patrick

google_play_reviews.content: Wow, okay... Met with server URL and API key entry fields. Then selecting "continue with demo" which responds with a server error version mismatch warning gobbledygook message. As a fellow developer, I apologize for the type of person who writes a piece of software like this.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks. You may read the "What's new" section in the store, there you can see that you have to join our public beta channel to receive 3.1.3 compatibility, otherwise you need a server with a running grocy 2.x instance. We are two 19-years-old brothers and both studying now, glad that you appreaciate the hundrets of hours of work in our freetime.

google_play_reviews.content: Great app
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Please read the "What's new" section in the Play Store, there you have all the information you need to get the latest beta version. Edit: Thanks for updating your review!

google_play_reviews.content: Nice apk. I able to connect to my Grocy server without problem. Integration well include requirement. My grocy server using latest version and apk manage to show limitation of software version warning before proceed. Still lot to explore and hope i can found another currency instead of usd only.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks! Please join the public beta channel here or download the latest release apk from GitHub for compatibility with grocy 3.0.x.

google_play_reviews.content: Are you going to be updating this to work with server version 3.1? Great app, but would love for it to be compatible with my server app.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Please read the "What's new" section in the Play Store, there you have all the information you need to get the latest beta version which is compatible with grocy 3.1.1.

google_play_reviews.content: Great work, love FOSS app, thank you for contributions to open source community.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: You're welcome! Thank you, too! Please join our public beta channel to get compatibility with grocy 3.1.1.

google_play_reviews.content: Looking forward to the 3.0 version.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Please join the public beta channel here or visit us on GitHub (github.com/patzly/grocy-android) to get the latest beta with 3.0 support! It's a completely rewritten app and you need grocy 3.0.x installed on your server.

google_play_reviews.content: Amazing app so far, I'd definitely buy a paid version so it can be improved with updates etc. Looking forward to compatibility with Grocy v3
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks a lot! We'll think about that, maybe the version with ML Kit for faster barcode scanning will be a separat app in Play Store which can be purchased. No matter how we decide, both versions will be available on GitHub for free. v2.0.0 is now available on GitHub for alpha testing!

google_play_reviews.content: excellent app. Looking forward for new update to fully compatible with the latest server version.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thank you so much! I hope you've already seen the issue on GitHub about the work in progress, so you won't miss the first release of the update!

google_play_reviews.content: Not sure if this is good or not, it tells me the v3 is not compatible. Smiley face...
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Grocy Android v2.0.0 is now available on GitHub for alpha testing.

google_play_reviews.content: Brilliant and useful companion app! Would it be possible to add 'transfer' functionality? It would be so useful to be able to scan something as it's moved from the pantry to the fridge without having to use the web interface.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Tanks a lot! That's right, this feature is coming soon, but the exact date has not been set yet. My brother is working hard for the next release!

google_play_reviews.content: Well thought of, pleasure to use. Thanks for making it!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Glad you like it, thank you!

google_play_reviews.content: Fast response
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks, update is out now :)

google_play_reviews.content: Great responsive app
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thank you!

google_play_reviews.content: Thanks for this!!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Glad you like it, thank you for your rating! :)

google_play_reviews.content: Amazing. Thank you for keeping this opensource and not mining our data <3
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks, you're welcome! Open-source is always a great solution for projects like this one.

google_play_reviews.content: Used only for a few moments but already better than using a browser remotely. Keen to use Grocy more now.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks a lot!

google_play_reviews.content: Very nice interface! A handy way to scan items into the server instance. It updates almost instantly. The only feature I could think of to request would be an offline shopping mode. I created a shopping list on the server and it populated to my Android, but when I leave my local network, the app indicates "Offline". It would be very handy to be able to work from the list and enter items as "Done" or, better yet, "Purchased" so the price could be entered at the store. Then, when back on my network and connected to the server, the current price would be included in the upload.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thank you! My brother is already working on a better offline integration, but the shopping list of the current version should work offline as well. The items are synced with an offline database and you should be able to go offline, open the lists and mark items as done as usual. The changes are then synced with the server when you're back online.

google_play_reviews.content: Very useful, i love the recipe part to help build a shopping list

Please add ability to attach pictures to products. It seems to be supported by the server, but not this app. EDIT: I am not familiar with the API. I take it does not expose ability to upload pictures?
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Our app has not much to do with the server application except the API. Also we would probably be more inclined to integrate this feature if you would appreciate our hard work so far and all the effort we put into it with more than three stars. EDIT: thanks, I meant the official grocy API our app uses. Yes we can implement picture support with that.

google_play_reviews.content: Awesome app!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thank you! :D
